intro: Pedicularis triangularidens subsp. chrysosplenioides, commonly known as the golden spleenwort pedicularis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant features showy, spurred flowers that are typically yellow or orange, adapted for pollination by insects. Its leaves are opposite and often hairy, and it grows in rocky or alpine habitats. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different floral morphology compared to the main species.
